intro: Eneodon urticifolia, commonly known as the stinging nettle tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its hairy, often stinging leaves and small greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a serrated edge, while its stems are woody and can grow up to several meters in height. Eneodon urticifolia is often found in humid, lowland areas and is known for its ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
